qas.question: What field of science studies the brain and the central nervous system?
What scientific field tries to understand the mind and behavior?
What field of science strives to diagnose and treat diseases of the nervous system?
Psychiatry is the branch of science that does what?

answers.text: study, prevent, and treat mental disorders

qas.question: Cognitive science seeks to join what two branches of science with other fields?

context: The field of <a0_0>neuroscience<a0_0/> encompasses all approaches that seek to understand the brain and the rest of the nervous system. <a1_0>Psychology<a1_0/> seeks to understand mind and behavior, and <a2_0>neurology<a2_0/> is the medical discipline that diagnoses and treats diseases of the nervous system. The brain is also the most important organ studied in psychiatry, the branch of medicine that works to <a3_0>study, prevent, and treat mental disorders<a3_0/>. Cognitive science seeks to unify <a4_0>neuroscience and psychology<a4_0/> with other fields that concern themselves with the brain, such as computer science (artificial intelligence and similar fields) and philosophy.
